subject: RE: [junit] New to Junit(Please help)
msgSnippet: First choose a starting point, probably the least complex class you have (file parser?) and write a TestCase for it.  The best way to learn JUnit is to do it,
messageBody:
First choose a starting point, probably the least complex class you have
(file parser?) and write a TestCase for it. The best way to learn JUnit is
to do it, ask questions when you get stumped, do it some more, ask questions
when you get stumped, do it some more, ask... You get the picture.

Also, take a look at the following pages:

http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?JavaUnit -- JUnit wiki
http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?JavaUnitBestPractices -- a BestPractices page for
JUnit
http://www.javaworld.com/javaworld/jw-12-2000/jw-1221-junit.html -- a
BestPractices article for JUnit

-Jason
